_comment: Created by ianb on 16/12/2014 11:16:41 using v2.3
title: How has alcohol related admissions to hospital changed?
analysis_commentary: Overall the rate of alcohol related hospital admissions (from recorded primary diagnoses) has remained broadly stable from 2008/09 to 2012/13. The peak rate of alcohol related admissions was 653 admissions per 100,000 population in 2011/12, having increased slightly in the years since 2008/09. A small reduction in the was seen in 2012/13 to 637 alcohol related admissions per 100,000.
data_source: Public Health England, Public Health Outcomes Framework indicator 2.18
